info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:12PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mineral and west central Missoula Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 312 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alberton, or 19 miles west of Missoula, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alberton, Frenchtown, Wye, Huson and Ninemile. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 75 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for west central Montana.
